Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: TeriBerry
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of homework and research about this TV and others before I decided to buy this one. Let me say that I made the right decision. I received the TV only 4 days after ordering. Very fast shipping I must say, and not to have paid extra. I was so excited!!Set up was a breeze!! I had no problems connecting to my wireless connection and was online and streaming Netflix in 10 minutes. Worked right away with my DirecTV, and works great with all DirecTV's HD channels. Awesome picture, and it has options for wide screen, normal, zoom, or panoramic viewing. Most of the time I have it set to Zoom option, which uses the whole screen. And the sound quality is the best!! At just 10 volume, it is plenty loud enough for me. I turned it up to 30 and could hear it throughout my house!!I've had this TV for 2 months now, and I absolutely love it!!I would highly recommend this model if you are looking for a TV that offers HD and Wifi, and yes, I brag about it to all my friends and family!!Again, AWESOME TV AND AWESOME PRICE!!UPDATE--1-26-2013AFTER ALMOST 6 MONTHS LATER, TV IS STILL GOING STRONG AND HAVE HAD NO ISSUES. I STILL HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TV IF YOUR IN THE MARKET FOR ONE!! IM LOVIN' IT!

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality and price for a smart TV - BUT see updates
Reviews.Author: liat2768 "liat2768"
Reviews.Content: The review below was written soon after purchase. Updates a few months later are below.The quality of the picture on this TV is absolutely amazing. It was simple to hook up and set up right out of the box. It accessed our home wi-fi network very easily and the quality of pictures streamed from Netflix was beautiful. No issues with connectivity at all.The menu is simple and intuitive to use. Initial set up (where you input your IP address, home address, Netflix information etc) can be a bit annyoing since the remote does not have letter keys but once done there is really no need to have to deal with that again. The only apps I have tried out so far are Netflix and Pandora. The sound quality when playing music is more than adequate for my needs.While it does not have the 120 Hz that supposedly helps while watching sports we have not noticed any issues with it being 'only' 60 Hz.Initially, when connected to our old AV equipment, the picture displayed on the tv was quite poor. However, that had more to do with the VCR/DVD and cable quality than with the tv. With the older dvd player we couldn't get the picture to be quite 'right' and the automatic backlight adjustment needed to be turned off. Once we switched to a blu ray player that upscaled our dvd's the picture was absolutey amazing. So, if you are using older equipment you may not see the full potential of what this tv can do.Also, since the TV is Wi-Fi capable we bough a blu ray that was a bit cheaper since it lacked wi fi but was excellent at upscaling dvd's. Samsung BD-E5300 Blu-ray Disc Player (Black)The tv has 3 HDMI inputs, one component input and one usb input. Our kids have their Wii hooked up using the component input and a regular 3 prong AV cable and, while nowhere near an HD picture, it works. The Wii does not have the HDMI option so the picture quality is a bit disappointing for wii games. The newer version of the Wii should function just fine.Warranty signup was easily done online and I did speak to the Vizio customer service (based in the US) to double check a few things and everthing went very well.We have only had this tv for less than a week but, so far, we are extremely pleased with it.Update Sept 2012: Still a terrific TV. Start up is a bit annoying especially if you use it only to stream Netflix or Amazon since it takes a good 2-3 minutes just to get the app started. Otherwise, everything has been excellent and we are still very pleased with the purchase.Update Jan 2013 : Stuck on vizio logo on startup. Chatted with vizio and they will have a tech contact me in 5 working days to schedule a repair. From what I am seeing online the main board seems to be an issue with this brand. I am very disappointed that this would happen with a six month old tv. I will post updates once service is completed. At this point I would not recommend buying a smart tv or a Vizio. Better to go with a blu ray that has the apps and a tv that just does one job  - being a tv.Update March 2013 : Took Vizio about three weeks to get a contractor out to fix the tv. He had to replace the entire mother board. Frankly, had they shipped to me with instructions I could have done it myself but it was under warranty so I suppose they had to do it. Three weeks felt like a very long time considering that you can get a part shipped cross country within a day in today's world. The tv is still lovely with a nice picture and sound but it is slowing down again on start up. If it dies again I will update this review. Otherwise, it is still alive and kicking!Update May 2013 : The saga continues! Still a beautiful picture but last week we started having issues with the remote control. Everything would start up fine for a few minutes and then only the power button on the remote would work. Contacted vizio about this via chat and, after doing some resetting of the remote and tv with no improvement, they sent out a new remote. The remote arrived in less than a week but did not fix the problem. While talking to vizio and trying to reset things, the back panel buttons on the tv conked out and then we got the lovely black screen of death for a few minutes. Vizio is, without any arguments but some expression of frustration on my part, going to send out a recertified (but NOT refurbished) identical tv. The rep emphasized that refurbished tv had repairs done whereas a recertified tv was just out of box or a customer return that they ahd to test and recertify as having nothing wrong with it.Should be here in two weeks and hopefully should work like a charm. I am pleased with vizio for customer service. Got a live American agent in less than one minute every time and they were very prompt and proactive in figuring out the problem. Not so pleased with the product itself but hopefully this particular tv was just a lemon!Update July2013. The recertified set was delivered very quickly and the delivery guys set it up perfectly. Unfortunately, it came with quirks of it's own. This one starts up fine but the volume controls, and sometimes the input selection, will not respond for the first five minutes. Wait it out and it work perfectly after that. Picture and sound, like the first set, are lovely. So, this was NOT an ideal purchase but with the 5 years of extended warranty I got with this thing, I'll be sticking with it for a while.I fully expect more issues with this thing within a year but don't think any more updates are necessary - this is not a TV I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E322AR
Reviews.Author: The P
Reviews.Content: PROS:Just bought this TV the other night and setup was easy, from a hardware point of view. Electronically connected to my DTV box and my home network with little effort, albeit, the remote was a bit touchy.Picture is what I would expect from a 720p unit of this size, clear and precise, good blacks with no artifacts visible.Sound is good with the surround turned on (from a surround broadcast channel).All-in-all, a great TV for the price, didn't really think I was going to find a "smart" tv in this 32" range with as many pre-loaded apps as this one has.If you're looking for a smaller (32") unit that will preform well in a bright light room, that can be seen from almost any angle, look at this model from Vizio.CONS:setup requires you to input some things with alpha-numeric characters and the remote only has numeric . . . keyboard is supplied on screen but navigates slowly until you get the hang of it.I had to use a Samsung code for my DTV remote to interface with this TV, the Vizio codes didn't work (probably too new for DTV to even know about it yet). Not Vizio's fault, a Directv issue.

Reviews.Title: 1 month update - buggy tv - downgraded to 3 stars
Reviews.Author: Tastinient
Reviews.Content: 1 MONTH UPDATE - I'm downgrading to 3 stars from 4.  Frankly the TV is buggy for my tastes.  The latest thing that displeased me is I could not get audio from my laptop to run through the TV speakers (PC audio in). So if you want to use this as a computer monitor, it's a major compromise.  Driver updates didn't work, trying HDMI audio didn't work, and I did a store exchange and the replacement didn't work either. Finally, Vizio tech support essentially blamed my computer (even though I've had no problems getting sound when I hook it up to other TVs. If someone here has solved this, and can leave a comment or tip, I'll gladly revoke the downgrade.)Here's my original review, which noted some other bugs.____I've owned several HDTVs and I think this TV has some strengths, but some bugs and weaknesses.PRO-Price is great for a web enabled TV-Quickly found my wifi network-Apps store is nice, lots of free choices. Weather, news, radio, Facebook, Twitter etc-Picks up channels via antenna as well as my name brand TVs do-Light and small profile for its size makes it a nice choice for small rooms-Use some apps (like weather and news) while watching TV.  MULTITASKERS rejoice! (I might have given the TV 3 stars instead of 4 until it exceeded my expectations here)-Customer service was easy to reach.CON-Remote clashes with LG TV and my Altec Lansing mini stereo, they seem to share some but not all remote functions-Some apps are buggy, lock up-Sound is good but not great, with some menu tweaks it improves-Menu system not very intuitive and kind of clunky-Small remote buttons-Viewing quality at side angles diminishes-Not a thin set, light and small footprint but chunky in back-USB flash drive appears to have an 8gb max. Wasn't mentioned in manual.-A little slow to power up, and then more lag time to connect to the web-App limit - you can only load a maximum of about 15 apps.-I'm having trouble getting audio to the TV from a PC.  Customer service not much help.I put this TV in my kitchen, which I think is about the right place for it.  I think I'll enjoy the option to play music and news with the apps, check Facebook and stream video, and to pull up news headlines and weather info while I wait for water to boil or during commercials etc.  Picture and sound are good for a budget TV and I hope to get better views with some more tweaking. However, I don't think I'd want to use this as my primary TV because of some of the compromises listed above.So far, I prefer turning the surround sound off, but setting the speakers to "Rock" mode to amplify the bass a bit. I find the video looks best in "vivid" mode in my brightly lit room.

Reviews.Title: Great TV...very pleased
Reviews.Author: NMSewHappy
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV at a great price!  The picture is clear, the sound is crisp and the setup was relatively easy.  My previous TV is 10 years old and way before current technology.  I have a cable box and as I expected I needed an additional cable to hookup my new TV, but didn't know exactly what I needed until the TV arrived.  I got a HDMI cable and connected the cable box to the TV HDMI outlet and got it setup.  When I first turned the TV on the setup would have been simple, if I had known what I needed to connect my cable box to the TV (my lack of knowledge not the TV)!  The coax connection is only if you are hooking up an antenna, not for use with a cable box. The Quick Guide would be much better if it said:  click on Menu on the remote, then Help and under help is the full owners manual.Setting up my wireless network was a snap...that was the easiest for me.  There is a Netflix and Amazon button on the remote.  Netflix was simple, login just like online.  The TV gives you a code for Amazon and as you are directed on the screen you have to register that code with Amazon for Prime Instant movies etc.  The V button on the remote also has a menu of apps and connections to Netflix, Amazon, etc.If you are not an Amazon Prime member, signup.  Its a bargain.  Just as many movies, TV shows, etc as NetFlix and you get free 2 day shipping for $79/yr.  That's cheaper than $7.99/mo.Even if I would have had to call my cable company to install this TV, it would be well worth the price.  Fortunately, I did it myself.  Other reviewers have said "it's only 720p." For me, this screen, sound and smart functions are wonderful.  Of course, I only use a cell phone for calls too so my needs are simple and this TV is the perfect size for my living room.

Reviews.Title: Great Affordable Internet app TV. Nice PQ, Ok AQ.
Reviews.Author: paper tiger "Adriel August"
Reviews.Content: I am a solid SONY electronic buyer and I have never had an issue. However due to cost, and less of a high usage, I decided to purchase 2 of these Vizio HDTV's for my home. I bought a 22" for the kitchen and this 32" for my boy's bedroom. I mounted it about a foot from the ceiling so that he can't get his slimy little hands on it. The TV is great, it is very light, solid and the picture quality is great. For what it is the sound quality is also nice and just right for what I am using it for.I really enjoy all the apps and he mostly watches Netflix. It is quick and easy to use. I also like the Netflix and Amazon buttons on the remote. As another revewer stated there are no composite hookups for this TV. I had to order a component cable from Amazon to hook up my son's DVD player to this TV.I will still always have my SONY 55" HDTV in the living room for main use, however Vizio is great for other TV's placed around the house. I think it was a great deal for such a nice HDTV. I would recommend it for the bedroom, kitchen or other area but NOT for your main living room HDTV because it is only 720p and the audio is not the best. Reviews.Title: Vizio E422AR - Great quality!
Reviews.Author: C Schmitt
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Vizio E422AR. We purchased this TV because of the value and quality of the Vizio line and prior experience with a 32" model.The picture quality is great and what I had expected, LCD was clean with no dead pixels, backlight is even. As others have noted, turning off the ambient light sensor via the menu brightens and further improves the picture.3 HDMI inputs, 1 combined composite/component input, VGA, USB, 1 RCA audio out, and 1 digital out on the rear. Plenty for our needs (DirecTV and Blu-Ray on HDMI, Wii on component.) Note, there are no separate side inputs on this TV.Sound quality is very good, plenty loud enough with good overall range and bass, doesn't sound like a tin can.TV Apps are easy to setup and use. Netflix, just login with your username. Amazon Video and Hulu display a code that you enter on their websites to authorize. There are other apps such as Vudu, YouTube, etc. The TV connects to your internet via WiFi 802.11g/n 2.4 or 5 GHz or a wired ethernet port on the back.Overall a great value for a mid-priced LCD, and can't beat Amazon's pricing, free shipping, and low price guarantee.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy for the price
Reviews.Author: Kishore
Reviews.Content: I bought this 10 days back and so far the experience is nothing but excellent.PRO:Low price with smart TV featuresSound quality is better than most of the TV's in this price range(esp better than my earlier philips tv)You tube appYou can pair you tube app from android or iphone by going to [...]CONs:Slow startup of TV as well as AppsWhen seen from a angle, picture looks little foggyNeed to make some initial settings like changing the color mode to "Vivid" etc to get best use of TVOver all i see this is very good buy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Vizio is great! ****MONITOR DELIVERY****
Reviews.Author: AMoney
Reviews.Content: We just ordered a Vizio television and it's great!! The picture is great, and the product performs as Vizio is known to!! The internet app are fun, they look great on the tv. The only reason I did not put 5 stars is because the first one I ordered was broken. Amazon is great, but the original tv was mishandled. What gets me is that UPS drivers sometimes should analyze what they ship. If your shipping televisions or some other fragile electronics, then be careful with it!! This isn't just for electronics, but for all packages!! It's not fair for consumers to use your services, and yet our shipments are either mistreated or lost!! That's the one issue I had!! The TV is great though!

Reviews.Title: As Good as More Expensive Brands
Reviews.Author: fancygoldfish
Reviews.Content: I've had this Vizio Smart TV for a month and my only complaint is the remote buttoms are too small. You have to use the Vizio remote for Netflix, Amazon, etc but the cable remote  works for everything else. At first the cable remote wouldn't work the volume, but cable guy fixed it. The colors and sound are good and it has a smart feature that selects the correct brightness for the room, but you can also select this and all the settings manuallyl. It's lightweight and can be wall mounted with the proper mount. There are lots of different ports, including USBs for multimedia content. There was a problem connecting to Netflix for the first time because I didn't get the code I was supposed to get and Netflix had no idea. (No problems connecting to amazon.com video library, etc.) When I called Vizio, they  had me reset the TV to all the default settings and start over. This was a bit of a hassle, but it fixed the problem. The cable guy helped me to get the right display settings, too. So there is a learning curve to this TV, but it may just be me, because I hadn't had TV for 3 years. (I had been using a digital projector and my purchased/rented dvds.) I still can't find anything to watch on cable, but I love my Vizio with Netflix and my Amazon video library. Also, this TV arrived fast in perfect condition, even though the packaging was minimal. UPS obviously takes better care of a box labeled TV than with regular boxes.Update: I've now had this TV 6 months and I'm even more pleased with it, now that I'm learning how to work it.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for awhile, but quirky after some time
Reviews.Author: Shane Ellis
Reviews.Content: Update: This tv has developed some quirky bugs that are very annoying.  At times, the tv won't turn off, either by remote or pushing the button on the tv.  I have to unplug it to turn it off.  I use this tv for netflix mostly and the netflix app seems to be freezing up on it more and more.  Half the time, it just says it can't connect and to try again later.  It isn't my connection or netflix, it is the tv.  The other half of the time the tv just completely freezes, the tv goes dark blue and nothing except unplugging for a minute will reset this. Add the slow startup and this has brought my original 4-star review down to 3-stars.Original review: This TV looks great and sounds great.  My only complaint is that it is slow turning on and starting up internet apps like netflix and amazon instant watch (which are the only two apps I have tried).  But I love that it has Netflix and amazon instant watch because I use them all the time.  I don't think you will regret buying this TV.  I don't.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV, Smart Buy
Reviews.Author: Jessi Bruton
Reviews.Content: I've owned the 42" model of this TV for about a week, and so far I'm very pleased. It seems tailor-made for people like me, who have ditched the cable box and watch TV elusively via the internet.The remote has 3 quick-keys that direct immediately to Amazon streaming (which seems glitchy, a couple TV shows I was watching stopped streaming partway through), Netflix (which works perfectly), and Vudu (which I've only browsed, but haven't yet watched any movies). In addition to those, you can hit the Menu button and bring up the additional apps, including Pandora, Hulu+, and a bunch of Yahoo apps like Weather, News Headlines, etc. What I love about the smart TV is that because all these services are built into the TV, it saves me the hassle of hooking up my computer to my TV, and there's no rats-nest of wires under the console.The major drawback to this TV is as other reviewers have mentioned, there is a lag between when you hit the power button on the remote until the TV finally turns on. Essentially you're waiting for the computer inside to boot up. This is also noticeable when you hit the menu button or quick keys to use Amazon, Netflix, or Vudu. It is annoying, but not enough to consider returning it.The picture is great, and so is the sound. Disclosure: I'm not a gamer or a real tech junkie, so there may be people who are picky who disagree. But for me, a casual TV watcher, it's perfect. And especially considering the price, I'd absolutely purchase this TV again.

Reviews.Title: Good but Doesn't Impress
Reviews.Author: Spudman
Reviews.Content: After looking and reading about TVs for months I chose this one based on its price ($450 at the time) and the Vizio brand. Our small kitchen Vizio has been a trouble free television with a decent picture.Set up wasn't bad, a litte tedious made more so by the inclusion of the Comcast box in the mix. The stand is really shaky and not sturdy or large enough for this television. I like the remote which has keys dedicated to internet channels, but with Comcast we must use their remote. The Vizio remote is only used for internet surfing.Sound - The sound is more than acceptable for us. Not overly impressive but good enough for us.  There are lots of settings for the sound that I haven't dabbled with yet, so maybe the sound can be improved a bit.Wait time - The TV doesn't turn on instantly and there is a waiting period for the internet to crank up. Can be annoying for the impatient.Picture - It's good but without the quality that would blow one away. Our basic Comcast service doesn't include HD quality which is part of the reason I can't rave about the picture. However, I have watched HD movies using Netflix and have accessed over the air HD channels with an indoor antenna. The HD picture is excellent, the kind of picture I was hoping for all the time. Those who have upper tier Comcast or FIOS will most likely be very satisfied with the picture on this TV.There are lots of ways to fine tune the picture and some preprogrammed modes like Movie, Vivid, Standard, Custom, Golf, Football, Movie, Baseball, Game.  I've had the best success with Game and Vivid modes.The remote has dedicated buttons for Amazon, Netflix, and Vudu.  Pressing the large V button in the middle of the remote brings on a list of internet channels that scroll across the screen. The list can be modified with additions or subtractions.  Netflix is great to watch and access. Amazon is terrible to access with tedious and limited access. There are lots of complaints by Amazon buyers for this reason. It's much easier to watch and choose movies on Amazon using Roku or the Amazon site on the computer.Set up for wireless wasn't too bad. Even this Potato Head figured it out.Would I buy this set again? Probably not for two reasons.First I am very disappointed by the crude Amazon interface on this television and in fact hardly ever watch any kind of internet on this TV. It was a novelty that soon wore off.Second, and I knew this would happen, I regret not buying a larger television for the living room. Our sofa is twelve feet plus from the television; I misjudged the size of the television. A 47" TV like I almost bought would have been perfect.Should you buy this TV? It depends on your type of connection, your room logistics, your viewing habits, and how often you'll be watching internet on the television. I hope this review helps at least a little.

Reviews.Title: Visio TV review
Reviews.Author: Isabela Stoff
Reviews.Content: not impressed with this TV, the remote does not work very well, when i called the customer service he suggested changing the batteries (REALLY do you think most people would try that before calling customer service for a remote!?! it just doesn't work) and you need it to enter the passwords/email address and other info in (just makes it more irritating) and it won't connect to the internet (the whole reason for purchasing a smart TV) i looked it up and the internet is littered with other unlucky Visio owners that can't connect to internet either. Again the irritating customer service rep suggested it is the router, but ALL of the wireless devices can connect, it's the TV the awful TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: my403bcoach
Reviews.Content: Really enjoy my new Tv.  Love the fact that you can acccess the web siting on your couch.. Great Deal

Reviews.Title: Great TV Great Price but....
Reviews.Author: craig paul
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Internet apps are a nice feauture for the $500 price tag. The TV is a little slow starting up but not a deal breaker.There is NO composite input on the TV, seems odd. While most components do not use use crappy composite video anymore, my kids GameCube does so it cannot be played on this TV. Kind of a downer there.Either way, good TV at a good price.

Reviews.Title: great picture and sound and smart tv features, but takes too long to warm up
Reviews.Author: steve-ft-laud "steve38735"
Reviews.Content: If the tv warmed up faster, then I would have given it 5 stars. Also, the apps are great, but having one that would allow me to freely browse the internet would be perfect. The technology can do that, but I suspect it's a question of vizio not making those few extra bucks that they get by controlling access to the internet thru apps that generate revenues for them.

Reviews.Title: I Love VIZIO
Reviews.Author: Claw
Reviews.Content: I have 3 of these babies in my house and this one I bought for the purpose of being my computer screen.  OK...So I'M BLIND and can't see.  On a more serious note, I have purchased Sanyo and  Sony and a couple others and they seem to give up the ghost in about 1 year.  Albeit, my family leaves the TV's on from dawn till dusk.  I finally purchased my 1st Visio about 2 years ago.  It has surpassed the extended warranty and is still going strong.  Needless to say, all the other flat screen failures have been replaced by Vizio TVs.  I love the picture, the sound, the price AND MOSTLY; I love the fact that they don't burn up in only 12 months.  If you want a good TV then go VIZIO.  You won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: There is a Composite Video Input!!!
Reviews.Author: Kent A. Compton
Reviews.Content: If you're like me you might have some older A/V equipment with Composite outputs (the Yellow plug).  While it's not mentioned in the overview, you'll be pleased to know that this television supports a composite input. In order to use composite you have to plug the yellow output into the Y/V input that's typically meant for the Component input. Of course, older A/V equipment typically plays in the 4:3, non-HD format but that's an expected/acceptable trade-off. I had also purchased a composite to HDMI converter device from Amazon that I'm now happy to be able to return.I'm not going to repeat the other reviews that focus on features and functionality but so far the TV is very good. The boot time (~30 seconds) is naggingly slow before HDMI content from my cable company is displyed. I can only hope it's using next to no electricity when "off" and boot is truly cold.

Reviews.Title: Nice tv
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Beat Walmart's price handily, and the free shipping and no tax was an added bonus!  Nice picture and great features, especially like that it's light weight, and the wi-fi and built in Amazon, Netflix etc. is great.  I recommend this item highly.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Brittany Swartz
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my room, and so far I love it! The reviews on Vizio are pretty good, and so far, this TV is no exception. The set up was so easy! Went a lot quicker than I thought it would for being a Smart TV. Which, I also love! The apps are great & easy to use! Once you open one, they only take up the side of your screen so can still watch your shows. I love that.It connects quickly to the WiFi as well. Nice picture & sound; of course not the best I've seen but for what I paid I have no complaints! Great TV! Worth it!

Reviews.Title: Great price value
Reviews.Author: Mo
Reviews.Content: Packaging is pretty decent. Tv is light and installation was pretty easy. Functionality of tv is v good considering the price, although more widgets wouldn't be a bad idea. The coloring is somewhat off n getting it to be just right is a little difficult, the tv also lags in its response time. But in general, for that price, it's a great but, just hoping it lasts a long time

Reviews.Title: Nice smart tv for a good price
Reviews.Author: xedii
Reviews.Content: I received the tv very quickly.. Im very pleased with the shipping, It came earlier than I expected. Its a 32" smart tv, smart enough to have apps like netflix, web videos and youtube. It also have some yahoo apps, twitter and facebook apps that you can use / run the apps while watching on netflix or regular tv program. In short, you can run two apps together at the same time. This tv is perfectly fine in my bedroom. I love how it works, and the graphics is not too bad, its great actually. The sound or volume is great too. Installation is too easy. I finished it for only few minutes, connecting the tv to internet wasnt so bad, you  could choose either wi-fi or ethernet cable. Remote control is kinda small but I didn't have any trouble using it. All in all I am very happy with my purchase, I have the TV for a month now, this was my first tv purchased and I am so glad that I did the right choice.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E322AR 32-Inch 60Hz Class LCD HDTV with VIZIO Internet Apps
Reviews.Author: Albert Deangelo
Reviews.Content: This TV is exactly what I wanted for a bedroom. The picture and sound are good.Remember it is a 720 not a 1080 TV.The TV automatically updates it`s software, which is one less thing to worry about.So far so good I purchased it the beginning of August.

Reviews.Title: Acceptable, but not excellent
Reviews.Author: William A. Fuller "The Old Bald Dude"
Reviews.Content: This TV provides adequate picture quality, but you really have to work to get it. Start by turning off all of the automagic stuff, particularly the automagic correction for room lighting conditions. It's really impossible to get consistently decent pictures with all of the helpful automatics turned on. There are a lot of color/brightness/contrast controls and their functions are not adequately explained in the instruction manual. Add to that the fact that the instruction manual was obviously written by a non-native English speaker, and you have a real problem on your hands. It took about 2 weeks, but ultimately I was able to tweak the picture to a point where is provides a very pleasing image to my eye. But it wasn't easy to get there, and with the automatics on, the picture was simply terrible.Sound quality was equally troublesome. The fake surround sound it absolutely unintelligible with some signals. Once again, turning off all the fancy stuff and manually adjusting the equalizer seems to be the best option.Once you do all that, you've got a good basic 32 inch TV, but if you're not into tweaking, this is not the set for you.Does a very good job of showing video from  an 8 gig (max) thumb drive and also does a good job streaming video from Amazon. But many of the apps are a total mess and will lock up the set and only a restart will cure it.At any rate, I'm reasonably happy with it as a TV, but I really shouldn't have needed to work that hard to get it to that point.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the low price
Reviews.Author: capecoddmb
Reviews.Content: Bought this because of the internet apps and the price was so good.  I just packaged it up and sent it back to amazon and will look for another brand.  The picture was just to dark.  No amount of fixing would change this.  When on pause you could see the picture flicker back and forth.  Very difficult to watch.  I went to a box store to see if it was the brand or just the one I had.  It is the brand.  At the store they had one a different model but next to other brands, the off color was very noticable.  Pay a little more and get better quality if you really like to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre TV
Reviews.Author: Keith A. Flores
Reviews.Content: I have owned this model now for about three months and it has been very frustrating.I bought it for the Internet apps and built-in wireless. It connects to the wireless network easily enough, but it does take some time to start up and get fully connected--on the order of about 30 seconds. I realize that may seem trivial, but when you compare that to a similar TV that starts up and connects in seconds, it becomes an issue.The apps are incredibly slow and difficult to use. There seems to be a significant lag time between pushing a button on the remote and seeing the TV respond when using the online apps. It gets very frustrating when you are trying to do a simple task like start a movie from your queue and doing so takes minutes instead of seconds.The picture quality is crisp and clear. The brightness is very good. As far as normal TV operations go, this unit is great.Bottom line:Picture: 4/5Sound: 3/5Wireless: 3/5Online Apps: 1/5Setup: 5/5Overall Performance: 2/5I bought this TV because it got good reviews and 4/5 stars, so I was inclined to believe that maybe I got a lemon unit. I talked with a friend of mine who has the same model and he reported similar issues (he actually returned his).

Reviews.Title: worst tv I ever owned
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: This TV constantly malfunctions.  At first I thought the problem was with Netflix, then I bought a ROKU for another TV and realized the problem was with the TV.  Now it's getting worse; the remote and buttons on the TV keep failing.  I'm fed up with it; wish I'd never bought it and wish I could do more than just warn others.  I actually might throw it away.

Reviews.Title: Good price, great picture
Reviews.Author: jeffrey m. newsome
Reviews.Content: My second Vizio, and I am really sold.  This is used in our bedroom, maybe three times a week, so I does not get nonstop use. With that said, after six months it is still great.  Sharp picture, good sound, familiar remote. Paired it with a Vid Secu mount. Great for watching in bed.

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: Danielle misner
Reviews.Content: Great tv specially for the price the only prob I have is once in a while the screen will go a little dark

Reviews.Title: I love this tv!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jrmancini
Reviews.Content: This tv is WONDERFUL!!! Haven't had any issues whatsoever. Very good price for a smart tv! Thank you for the fast shipping and wonderful tv.

Reviews.Title: Very good set for the price.
Reviews.Author: Mary Gallagher
Reviews.Content: Very good picture and lots of features including Internet applications using a wireless network. Very good for a second or third set. The only complaint I have is the tiny remote control with very small buttons that are so close together. Also overly sensitive buttons that must be pressed quickly or 3 or 4 repeats appear. Press channel 3 and it might come up as 333.

Reviews.Title: No Amazon Watchlist, poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Karen "Karen"
Reviews.Content: Trying to use this tv with Amazon Prime Video is a thoroughly frustrating experience. (See the Amazon forum "Watchlist on Vizio" http://www.amazon.com/forum/amazon%20video%20on%20demand?_encoding=UTF8&cdForum;=Fx3EQAX98ED5WQ3&cdThread;=Tx2P9XXYW5SIIMT for details.) I've been trying to communicate with both Amazon and Vizio about this. Based on the quality of responses, I have to conclude that Vizio has an understaffed and under-informed customer service unit, and the Vizio company refuses to take any responsibility for a technical problem that is clearly at least partly its own. (Amazon makes the same "widget" available to multiple brands; why can't Vizio figure out how to make it work when other brands can?)The software compatibility issue is a pain, but frankly, I'm more disturbed by Vizio's poor track record communicating with customers. Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: Best in class
Reviews.Author: Argentina traveler
Reviews.Content: VIZIO has remarkable sound, with lifelike color.  I watched an episode of Sopranos when I first got the television, and thought the crickets were inside my house because the sound was so lifelike.  I hadn't had a flatscreen television before.  This 31-inch one fit perfectly even though I was afraid it would be too large.  Some tricks--the VIZIO takes about 25 seconds to turn on.  The remote control included with the television has a button at the top saying "Amazon" and "Netflix."  (This is the Internet feature.)  Took me several months to realize my Amazon Prime let me watch television shows and movies for free by pressing the "Amazon" button on remote control.  Best if you have Amazon Prime.  You'll get free delivery of the television, plus the benefit of free movies and television once the set arrives.  Easy to set up.  Price--unbelievable low!

Reviews.Title: Piece of Crap
Reviews.Author: Edwin S. Goll
Reviews.Content: Don't get carried away with the great price. I bought three of these. One was bad out of the box. One went bad after two months. A tech was dispatched both times to repair the units. One unit went bad again two months after repair. Support is hit or miss. Sometimes you get someone that is very helpful and sometimes you have to settle for someone acts like they are doing your favor. Spend a little extra for something else and a piece of mind.

Reviews.Title: Internet apps don't work / update: fix by clearing memory...
Reviews.Author: J. W.
Reviews.Content: As a TV this works, though wish it had more than one composite / component input to support older game systems.The reason for only 2 stars is that we use this primarily for Netflix.  Well, it worked for a few weeks, now it will not connect at all to Netflix. And as a solution what does the tv on screen message suggest?  Go to Netflix for tv help?  Wait a minute...I thought I just paid money for a vizio tv!  Why isnt Vizio providing support?  Not very encouraging.Some might say signal strength is a problem...from the same room the tv is located, we have no problems connecting to out wifi (and stream from Netflix) using an iPad, multiple laptops, an iPhone, a Galaxy phone, and an HTC phone.  Only thng not working is this TV.Update:Added one star...after restoring to factory conditions (did not work) then clearing memory (had to reconfigure everything again) Netflix once again started working.  If it continues to work without any glitches, then I will update the rating for this TV.

Reviews.Title: Takes too long to power on
Reviews.Author: Kelly Hidalgo
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture, but it takes 2-3 minutes for the TV to "warm up" before the picture comes on.  It's not a deal breaker but I have not owned a TV since the 80's that had to warm up.

Reviews.Title: it works well.
Reviews.Author: 007 "Wind Flower"
Reviews.Content: it works well. the only thing is the build-in wifi, sometimes difficult to find signal. overall, so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Janine Ellenbeck
Reviews.Content: Decent TV for the price, I still haven't figured out how to hook up the cable but the rest of the apps suffice.

Reviews.Title: Great picture!
Reviews.Author: R. Snyder
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for Christmas. I was surprised how nice the picture was on this TV compared to other similar brands. The price was very good too for a smart TV. I see that the price has changed since Christmas; I purchased it for $279.99 through Amazon. The TV connected easily to the internet. It was a little odd to figure out that you had to enter "ok" on the remote to pull up the onscreen keyboard. That could be a little clearer or explained in the instructions. The Netflix button on the remote is nice. The TV is very lightweight. There are no plans to connect this TV to laptops or audio systems so I cannot review those features or compatibility, but for basic TV and streaming it is great.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for price,
Reviews.Author: rickas
Reviews.Content: Disappointed that it does not have a FULL web browser.  My fault for not completely reading description. Excellent picture and sound for patio TV

Reviews.Title: Very affordable high quality LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Medinah
Reviews.Content: I ended up buying two of these TV,  I was impressed by the features and the picture is bright with outstanding definition,

Reviews.Title: 3.5 stars for this one
Reviews.Author: OMARF
Reviews.Content: The reason I put 4 stars is because I can't put 3.5 , the picture quality is great, is 42" and is heavier than my 50 inch in the living room, is thick, and takes like 30 seconds to start is not like others tv sets is the only bad thing about the TV ,,,so if you don't mind wait 30 second after press power,,,,, is a great tv ,, the quality of picture is super nice with netflix works perfect, good apps you can read news while watching other things, multitasking, good tv, I paid $499 6 monts ago,,, today is $394.Update.  9 months after purchased. You can't turn it off without the remote control. Terrible TV I down grade the rating from 4 to 2 stars , sometimes I has to be unplugged because the screen goes black and does not accept any command. I would not recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Big bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: lewi
Reviews.Content: The built in WiFi and smart TV apps made a smart TV a must.  I have this in my waiting room of my office and the access to the WiFi allows my clients to watch netflix with easy while waiting.  1 button on the remote.  The picture is great for an LCD TV.  It is overall a great TV for how little it costs.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: michael tecce
Reviews.Content: better than described...easy to set up...great picture...dont know how i did without it....so easy my wife can operate it. might by another for the garage

Reviews.Title: Vizio
Reviews.Author: John Scruggs
Reviews.Content: I just love this LCD I get to watch every thing in high definition and more vizio makes really nice flat screen's my next one for the living room will be a sixty inch by vizio complete with surround sound system I hope vizio keeps up the good work

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Got for fiance at a holiday super deal of $350.  Should've bought more as they are now selling at close to $500.  Perfect room size and she loves playing her Tomb Raider PS3 games on it.  For the price it couldnt be beat.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV with one flaw
Reviews.Author: JustAThot
Reviews.Content: Great TV at a wonderful value. Picture quality is good but the real selling point is the built in wireless and internet apps. There are TON of video and music options most of which are free. A few minor glitches but for the price its excusable.  Only major fault I found was that  the ambient light sensor will interfere with the remote for your cable box.  Disabling the feature does NOT fix problem. There are a bunch of DIY suggestions online but I opted to download the application for my smartphone and use that instead of the standard remote

Reviews.Title: 4 1/2 stars, really
Reviews.Author: VLD13
Reviews.Content: I'd give this TV 4 1/2 stars if I could. It's a very nice little bedroom TV for a reasonable price. LOVE THE WI-FI! That makes it awesome. We can log into Netflix with no gaming system. The TV operates like a computer, so it does take a moment to activate Netflix and get you logged in (it's not instant). But, it's still probably less time that if I had to turn on the Wii, get switched over, and log in through the Wii.Picture is great, we use rabbit ears to get the digital local TV stations and they come in very strong and clear (much better than our old TV).You can turn the white "VIZIO" logo off so the glaring light doesn't keep you awake. I found it annoying too while watching a movie in the dark (I kept wanting to read it like a subtitle when it caught my attention). So that feature is off, and staying off!The only complaint I have is very minor... I WISH the remote lit up. Even if just for 15 seconds when you pushed a button. It's near impossible for me to see what button I need to push without turning the lights on full bright. I know it's a minor thing, but it would make me love the TV even more. I guess with time, I'll learn which keys are which and be able to navigate the remote without looking.I'm glad I made the purchase. Man, did it arrive quickly!!!! We love the TV and are happy with it.

Reviews.Title: just too quirky
Reviews.Author: Resourceress
Reviews.Content: picture is okay, sound okay,  easy access to Netflix is nice, but Internet access info is in very small print on the screen so we had to rearrange the bedroom to get it close enough to read. Takes forever to start up, has a lag just changing channels, amazon prime works fine with the featured movies, but if you search for a movie, then try to watch it, it never stops loading !! Think we have to return it since it doesn't do all it's suppose to.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money overall
Reviews.Author: bryantb
Reviews.Content: Picture is good, but slow start time is annoying. The 'connected' aspect is intriguing, but currently few useful applications other than the usual suspects of NetFlix, Amazon, etc. Really wish that there was a SlingPlayer app available. Works well as a wall-mounted television for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Excellent smart TV
Reviews.Author: Samuel O.J. Spivy
Reviews.Content: This Vizio TV does everything I wanted. It arrived in perfect order and quickly and what was most gratifying, when I had a question during setup, was that the Vizio guy -- an American in Utah -- walked me through the process over the phone, as I clicked through the steps. Excellent all the way around.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!!
Reviews.Author: laura
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the money! Easy setup, took about 20 mins start to finish. Very easy to connect to my wifi. Just hooked up and already watching hulu! Great picture and sound quality. Very happy with this purchase!!

Reviews.Title: Very Impressed
Reviews.Author: Greg J Navarro
Reviews.Content: I cant believe how many features this TV comes with.  The wireless and applications that it comes loaded with are great.  The picture is very nice.  I really like the menu and the remote.  Too easy to setup.  For the price I can not imagine a better TV.  To me this is a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: Really good buy
Reviews.Author: Joellen
Reviews.Content: I really loved the fact that this tv has built in wifi... i love it!very easy to set up.I swear i'm always watching Netflix on it.very good price for a smart TV.

Reviews.Title: I got a lemon
Reviews.Author: Ann George "Ann George Studios, Inc."
Reviews.Content: The TV is actually a great TV. However, the one I bought from Amazon was a lemon. Further, the diagnostic and repair process from Vizio was tedious. I finally returned the TV to Amazon and got a ride to a local big box retailer.The TV from the local store worked like a charm. So...... it is a great TV. ( Sometimes slow to connect to the internet... or to remember your password, so you have to log into your wireless router every time you want to watch on line.Amazon was great. I got full credit, no problems with the return.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Anon220
Reviews.Content: Good value. Especially like the wireless ethernet link.Reasonably good picture. Color is not as brilliant as some sets. Contrast may be a bit less.Depends a lot on the source and content.Menus are easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for the money
Reviews.Author: TigerLilly
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to purchase a TV online.  But my fears were invalid.This TV is great value.  It was so easy to install.  Basically just turn it on, press a few buttons and presto, I was watching netflicks. Its not super high end, but then look at the price. Great price for what I got.

Reviews.Title: Vizio has become a family favorite
Reviews.Author: UrbanRedTag
Reviews.Content: We've found that Vizio has proven to be of quality and value, especially with features that are overly-priced in other makes. This particular model has built-in Internet apps with a remote control that has the Netflix and other online buttons. This is our family's second purchase on a Vizio with Internet apps, but third brand purchase thus far. We find that the value, quality and features seem to advance over our LG and Samsung models of similar size, age and features.This was an upgrade purchase for a birthday gift and, once again, Vizo has proven to be worth the money spent. Amazon took a while to actually have it shipped, but was relatively fast getting to us once it was. But, with free super saver shipping, one cannot complain about the length of ship time.I definitely recommend this TV for the above reasons, especially at less than $300 pre-tax.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the bucks
Reviews.Author: IW
Reviews.Content: It was very easy to install and configure. Great value for the price! I would recommend this Rpoduct without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: Totally satisfies with my new Vizio
Reviews.Author: Lynn B
Reviews.Content: The TV we got was a smart Tv.  Ready to be set up for wirless Netflix, Amazon Prime and other sites.  It was very easy to hook up to the wirless with easy instructions to follow.It's for my husband but I really would like one for myself also, it's so neat.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Jason Tillery
Reviews.Content: Receive next day - hung up on wall and the remote or side controls would not work.  Called Vizio - they wanted to send someone out and replace a part.  Difficult time getting appointment set up as Vizio did not send initial e-mail as stated.  Week and half later someone comes out - replaces three internal parts.  TV back up on wall and while setting up - same problem occurs.  Called Vizio back - they will only send replacement once initial TV is returned and processed (about 2 weeks).  Now the TV was cheap, thus the purchase, but leaves me second guessing having purchased my first TV not named Sony.  Have not had a change to enjoy TV or know what it's about.  Do know the hardwired power cord is a pain to hang TV on wall and feed through wall to outlet - would be much easier if able to do this with out the TV up on bracket.  Disappointed in Vizio and their lack of concern or going out to their way to at least send us the replacement TV ASAP.  At this rate, it may be a month from purchase to time of actually being able to use the TV.

Reviews.Title: Super High Quality TV, with a Killer HD Picture...with one downside.
Reviews.Author: Abraham B. Bowater
Reviews.Content: After doing lots of research on 42" Tv's in this price range, I decided to spend my money on this Visio. It has been stellar thus far (3 mnths or so). The picture quality is great and viewing from any angle is nearly perfect.  I'm not gonna get real technical, but I see no lag whatsoever in the picture when it comes to action movies or sports viewing.As far as the Internet apps, I've used the yahoo weather app and YouTube.  The weather app is nice, and the YouTube app streams perfect HD video. Overall, I think it's a gimmick.  I would have bought the set if it didn't have the web stuff built in.The only negative thing about the LCD is that because it's a computer (with the apps), it takes litterally a minute or so to actually boot up.  It's only annoying when I come home and try to catch the end of a game or something.  Then, a minute seems like forever! I know it's not that long, but if you are impatient when it comes to stuff like that, beware.That's my only gripe. I would buy another VISIO if I ever needed to.

Reviews.Title: Ok TV, Bad Connection
Reviews.Author: Alan
Reviews.Content: We bought this for the sole purpose of streaming netflix in the bedroom. Unfortunately, using an apple airport express router, The TV was only able to connect three times over wireless. That was 3 times out of 50 tries. Each attempt to connect shows a progress image for atleast 5 minutes each time before it fails. Moving the modem/router into the same room as the tv did not help any. We finally tried using the ethernet port connected directly from the modem, with no luck.  Gave up and returned to target, with a full refund (Luckily!)Also the remote feels like it is totally empty, with cheap buttons.As far as the picture, It looked fine to me, but I was only able to watch a couple shows on netflix.The volume control is strange.  the usable range is very small.  0 is silent, 1 is not quiet enough, and by 5 the speakers sound like they will blow.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E322AR
Reviews.Author: Linny
Reviews.Content: 8-29-12 CUSTOMER ALERT: I've recently received the following message. Please be informed that, At this time, Amazon Instant Videos can't be watched on your "VIZIO E322AR 32-Inch 60Hz Class LCD HDTV with VIZIO Internet Apps". This is response to my inquiry regarding this model not being featured on the compatibly listing.+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++Purchased this TV in July. It arrived quickly,in fine condition. This is my first experience with High Definition TV. Therefore, I am not real savvy. The TV appears to be fine with the exception of some occasional scratchy noises viewing Turner Classic Movies.My cable service changed out the cable box and set up the TV. The next day a very electronic savvy friend arrived at my home and we attempted to connect to the internet by utilizing the Ethernet cable from my modem. We were not successful. Don't have wireless service.We called Vizio customer technical support for assistance. He was unable to resolve the problem and suggested we revert back to the factory default and try again. Still did not work.A second call was made to Vizio. She informed us that their was a communication issue and advised we call the cable tv provider for assistance.After contacting the cable tv provider we were assured that all equipment was in working order. This left us feeling unsure what to do next.A previous troubleshooting call had been scheduled with the cable tv provider for problems unrelated to the internet connection. Solution: Cable technician refreshed the DCHP and matched the IP numbers, then downloaded the internet. If the outcome had not been not favorable I was prepared to return the product.*Vizio technicians should have been able to offer a solution to this problem. Quite frankly, this experience left me with a great deal of doubt weather I had made the right choice by purchasing a Vizio product. *Something is seriously lacking when a first time purchaser can not get help from highly trained technical experts. (supposedly)My opinion regarding the "lack of quality customer service" offered by Vizio has really tainted my review.

Reviews.Title: What a waste of my time.
Reviews.Author: DRR
Reviews.Content: I received the same TV twice. The first one did not work as soon as I pulled it out of the box. The second unit turned on but would freeze when using the internet apps. Maybe it's just my bad luck!The only good thing was Amazon was extremely helpful with solving my problem and provided me with great customer service.

Reviews.Title: Great start BAD Support
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I used to like Vizio products and this was another good purchase I thought for all the features you get verse price.  There are lots of apps but a bit slow in start up and picture quality was good and it worked for 6 months.  On January 2nd the TV would not work - I could get the emblem so screen still worked but could not access any menu or inputs etc...  Thought no big deal will contact Vizio since the tv is still under warranty.  Contacted Vizio ran through all their tech support hoops determined TV is broke - I cannot return TV to store and get a replacement must get it repaired OK. "The repair company will contact you within 72 hours" I was told both over the phone and via email.  A week later I contacted the repair company and they said Vizio did not have the parts and that I was to contact Vizio.  I asked why did you not call me to let me know the repair company replied "Vizio said they would contact you we are not involved any more."  So I contacted Vizio and they had to check and run through more hoops - yes parts are out of stock (they could not tell this the week prior?) we will have to arrange to have a "Recertified" tv sent out to you and the company will contact you in 8-13 business days.  8-13 business days which translates to 2-3 weeks for just the call to arrange for delivery.So for a TV that is only 6 months old it sits broken for over 18 days and I am still waiting for this company to call me to let me know when they can deliver a "Recertified" TV.  While I may not know exactly what a "Recertified" TV is but I am sure it is not a NEW TV.Vizio products are great when they work - I have several but my 1st experience with their warranty is not good at all.  I will have to seriously think about purchasing another Vizio product - every company can make mistakes or have defects but how they handle it is the true test of a great company. Vizio FAIL!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product 6 months ago, and it stopped working after minimal use. Vizio sent a repair tech to my home to fix. This took two weeks. Less than 24 hours after the main board was replaced, the tv is now not working. I was told I can wait another 5-6 business days for the tech to come back and look at the TV. Unacceptable. Poor quality. Poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality
Reviews.Author: Ann Bedingham "Ann Bedingham"
Reviews.Content: The smart TV meets all of our viewing needs especially with the easy availability of internet and Netflix program access.

Reviews.Title: 5 star
Reviews.Author: Roger Frisinger
Reviews.Content: Video with apps. Bigger than thirty two inches.  Excellent picture.  Good sound.  I would buy it again.  Eighteen, nineteen, twenty.

Reviews.Title: electronics101deals does not inform you that OEM warranty will not apply to TV's that you buy
Reviews.Author: Carol D Turpen
Reviews.Content: TV purchased from electronics101deals via Amazon. The TV had not been turned on from November 2013 until May 24 2014 which was three weeks past the warranty end date, and the screen was bad. I Contacted Vizio TV and they said their warranty was void because Wal-Mart had liquidated my TV to electronics101deals and the original warranty did not apply. electronics101deals said the warranty was out no matter if it was one day or one year it was all the same.Not that it matter but I told electronics101deals I would make sure to not purchase their items again.

Reviews.Title: Did not know about this brand
Reviews.Author: Fran
Reviews.Content: My son-in-law did the research and told me Vizio had very good ratings.I was a Sony buyer until now.  This has great clarity and great sound.  It wasthe perfect addition to my bedroom.  Now I own a larger one for my living room.Go Vizio!

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: David Mah
Reviews.Content: Got it my parents who are old and can't see clear.Special my mother complained it was way too big but love it now.easy to control,the downside is remote too small and too sensitive.

Reviews.Title: No Quality JUNK
Reviews.Author: joewyo
Reviews.Content: Purchased two of these in August and September 2012. Both worked great for awhile then one went out today after only 18 months. It appears to be the board problem that others have described here. I also purchased the newer model E320-A1 last year and it went out after about 3 weeks. Amazon replaced the E320 but the replacement was bad out of the box. It seems that Vizio has a serious quality control problem. Power surges, brownouts, etc. can cause problems with LCD/LED units but I use UPS battery backup units on all my TV's to protect them from power problems so there in no excuse for these defects other than poor quality. Sure these TV's have a lot of bang for the buck but if they are only going to last a few months past the warranty period you are just throwing money away. Needless to say, I have purchased my last Vizio product.

Reviews.Title: Is good enough for the price
Reviews.Author: ccalder1829
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 of them and send them to Costa Rica they worked ok but the product is cheap the remotes stop working before the first year and 1 of the units had a mother board problem that I had to replace I can tell it was a cheap fix too that is why I would recommend it if you have low budget. As it does what it needs to do for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Kids Room
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Nice technologically advance Internet access television with access to FB, YOUTUBE etc Nice picture daughter loves it! Good price also I recommend this unit

Reviews.Title: Lasted one year!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Moore-Peters
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television in Nov. of 2012, loved it because I didn't need extra boxes for Netflix. Picture was beautiful, sound great was really enjoying it until this year exactly one year and 3 months after I purchased it the screen suddenly went black and no sound!!! So VERY PISSED! Who would have thought a TV would last one year? Lesson learned. Will not purchase another TV from Amazon. So shocked never had an issue with their products til now.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied customer:)!!!!
Reviews.Author: Mark Navarro "M.F.en Navarro"
Reviews.Content: 5+stars for this item. It was delivered in a reasonable amount of time. Especially considering the frozen conditions a good part of this packages route. The seller was quick to answer my questions. Plus it was a great deal for a smart tv such as this. Im loving it. Linked my amazon video libary(as well as a few other acounts) with no problem. Very satisfied with this purchase all around. 5stars for the seller as well. Would highly reccomend to anyone.(tv &the; seller)

Reviews.Title: Died after 11 months
Reviews.Author: Jon Doe "Jon Doe"
Reviews.Content: The picture stopped after 11 months. I am not a big time TV watcher either, this was used for an hour a day or less. Worked well when it worked. But a TV should last for years, not months.When I inquired about warranty, there was a $180 "inspection fee" or something to that effect... plus shipping. Not pleased, bought a new tv.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Melina
Reviews.Content: It works great, but start up times can be quite long. I mounted it on the wall and the wireless works flawlessly for Netlix and the other apps. I just love Vizio TV's and I'm going to keep buying them.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Breiner Oliveros "Amazon enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: It's a great TV, perfect for a bedroom. Apps work perfectly and the picture look crisp. Easy set up and great customer service when you have any questions

Reviews.Title: One year old and 90% positive
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Maler "Chris"
Reviews.Content: There are a few things about this tv I don't like.1 very slow start up time is annoying2 DLNA does not work and crashes every time.3 the auto brightness leveling is worthless.Otherwise the picture is very good, sound is ok for a tv, but a soundbar makes a huge improvement.

Reviews.Title: Great picture & sound. Slow processor.
Reviews.Author: Tom P
Reviews.Content: I found this TV at a local Target store for $300 in March 2013, which was a little hard to believe, but I figured it was worth a shot at that price, which I was prepared to pay for a 32". My only guess is that the store was trying to turn over inventory and get all their 2012 models out. This was the last of this model available in my metro area.I had initially planned to buy a regular TV and a Roku box to run apps, which is a setup that a family member of mine has and I really liked. I primarily use my TV to stream Amazon Prime or Pandora, which generally work great after waiting a few minutes for the TV to turn on and connect to wifi. I can't say that I love the format of the apps, but again, for the price I can't complain.Overall I'm extremely impressed with the HD picture quality (using a BluRay player or streaming HD movies on Vudu) and sound. My main issue with this TV is the slow processor - as you'll read in other reviews, it takes a few minutes for the apps to load and scrolling through the menu can be laggy. I would love to see Vizio create an app that is compatible with iPhone and Android (like Roku has) that would enable typing, as searching Amazon, Pandora, YouTube, etc. can be a pain, especially with the lag. I have had some trouble with internet connectivity while watching shows or listening to music, which might be more attributable to my router than the TV. That being said, I don't have these issues with my laptop.

Reviews.Title: One year later review
Reviews.Author: tratl1963
Reviews.Content: I love Vizio products and have one of these in the living room (going on two years old now) and the bedroom. I have only had one issue with this TV in the year I have owned it (due to a Vizio upgrade) and to Vizio's credit, after sending them photos of the screen and describing the problem, they promptly scheduled a service call at no charge, and the problem was corrected in less than 15 minutes by the technician.Great service from Vizio and a reliable and affordable product.

Reviews.Title: wonderful TV
Reviews.Author: bobbi
Reviews.Content: its been great since owning it. looks nice. internet works nearly instantly when applied. all around, yes, good product! would recommend.

Reviews.Title: 2nd time buying visio - never again!
Reviews.Author: Curt
Reviews.Content: My first visio died after 15 months. This one died after 13 months. I guess if you buy cheap you get cheap. It's a lesson thats oh so tough to learn. Denial is a powerful motivator!

Reviews.Title: Great Concept, Poor Execution
Reviews.Author: MCM485
Reviews.Content: Great concept, poor execution. This TV has significant motherboard problems unique versus any other Vizio TV. A common problem with them is freezing at the Vizio Logo startup screen. The apps take quite a while to load (in minutes, most times, not seconds). We have already had a warranty repair done on our TV and now we have to start a second process of getting it repaired. It now freezes in apps or while trying to shut it down (stays backlit and vizio logo stays white not orange). This TV was a gift last Christmas, so it's certainly not old enough to justify two critical repairs. Save the money and buy a bigger TV and hook your laptop up to it. At least you'll know it's faster and more reliable.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a small space
Reviews.Author: Jaguar 90 "Liz"
Reviews.Content: I love the internet apps that came with this TV. I read all about it but never realized it was as a much computer as TV,

Reviews.Title: The best television I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Jilleen Dennis
Reviews.Content: Easy access to netflix, youtube, and other apps. I was able to bring up exercise videos on youtube, which made it extremely easy to do my workouts. The netflix app is great, and I used it all the time. The picture is very crisp and clear, and I absolutely recommend purchasing this television.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, just takes a few seconds to turn on.
Reviews.Author: RSH
Reviews.Content: I like this TV, but it does take a second to turn on.  It seems like it shouldn't take so long to power up.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this!!!!
Reviews.Author: Lucia Kern
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this tv!!! Bought it last year, less than a year old and the element went out on it. It only comes with a 6-month warranty and since we bought it from Amazon, VIZIO won't replace it or offer any kind of help for us. According to a local(Fort Collins, CO) tv technician, he said this happens a lot with this tv. Apparently we should have bought the extended warranty. Shame on us. $250 + for the part and that doesn't include the labor. Really, really unhappy. At this point considering tossing it and buying a new one at Black Friday deals. Will NEVER, EVER  buy another VIZIO product again.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad tv...just not a great tv. But for this price....
Reviews.Author: kfsutops
Reviews.Content: This TV is what it is. Nothing great. Nothing dramatically wrong with it either. The picture quality is pretty good. I mounted the device to the wall and added a sound bar. Where this device lacks is the software support. The internet apps all come from the yahoo store. Who knew yahoo had a tv app store. Nothing every seems to get updated. If you are looking for updated internet applications or most up to date software this is not your tv.

Reviews.Title: Takes way too long to turn on
Reviews.Author: C.L.
Reviews.Content: It has the internet functions, but they are difficult to access.  I wish it had one-click access to each of the internet options.  Also, the TV takes a painstakingly long time to turn on.  Usually I turn on the TV, then go brush my teeth or something while I wait for it to start up.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.....cheap crap.
Reviews.Author: Shawn S
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about a year ago.  At first I was happy enough with it.  It comes with ethernet & WiFi connectivity, streams Netflix, Amazon, etc, plays media files from a home network, has multiple HDMI inputs, etc, etc.  Plus it is only $280 for all that it comes with.  So, you are probably thinking that you should go out right now (or on to Amazon) and buy this TV today, right?  Wrong. There are several problems with this TV, and Vizio for that matter.  First, it seems great for a little while but then the nagging little issues start.  It locks up when streaming video.  Often when you fast forward a streaming service it will lag way, way behind, which is particularly annoying.  You suddenly can't control the TV with the remote; no the batteries are fine.  You can't turn the TV off which requires a "hard reset."  And finally, you get the common issue of the "stuck on spash screen" or "stuck on Vizio logo screen."  Go ahead, Google "Vizio TV stuck on splash screen."  See, this TV is a piece of junk.  Also dealing with Vizio is a trip all its own.  Do yourself a favor and buy something else.Or do what I did and not heed the warnings of others and buy this TV, or any Vizio TV for that matter, and face the annoying consequences.

Reviews.Title: WIFI TV
Reviews.Author: Gerard Matton
Reviews.Content: While you have to wait for it to boot like a computer when you turn it on I was looking for a TV to connect wirelessly to my home network without having to use and X-Box or DVD player and this did the trick.

Reviews.Title: We've owned this TV for over 6 months..
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This TV has been in our bedroom for the past 6 months, used multiple times a week. I have been extremely impressed with the quality of the tv. I love being able to easily access Netflix in bed. There is a slight start-up delay, but it's not bad to the point of annoyance.

Reviews.Title: I love this television
Reviews.Author: Jovette Sinclair
Reviews.Content: I simply adore my television works like a dream.  We bought this last year for our family room as my husband is a sports lover and we purchase and HD receiver to go with it.  It's like heaven the pictures are so bright it's like actually being there in the show setting. The sound is great.  Thanks Amazon.Signed: Jovette Sinclair

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great price, Little fuss
Reviews.Author: Moxie
Reviews.Content: See, my relationship with technology is more love/hate than anything. I have learned to tolerate the up's and down's that come with the rapidly changing world of electronics. On that note, I know little about electronics and I just want them to work. I don't want to worry about them, I don't want to have to spend an afternoon setting something up. With that said, this TV was easy to set up and quick.My only issue is a minor one, the Internet connectivity seems to be slow despite my modem/router being within inches of the TV.The picture is clear but I'm not picky. I mostly watch the news and I do not have cable to get all the perks. When I watch something on Hulu and the like, it can stall, but I don't pay the extra for the higher Internet speeds the TV may need.

Reviews.Title: Fuzzy yet Functional
Reviews.Author: Julie Aamold
Reviews.Content: Honestly, we were hoping for a little better quality.  We own other Vizio products and enjoy the quality.  The set we have has a fuzzy or blurry picture at best, but it is functional and serves our needs.

Reviews.Title: Did Not Work
Reviews.Author: R
Reviews.Content: Product did not work. Display looked like a plaid piece of cloth; just a random bunch of colored lines.Very, very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: Worst tv ever!!!
Reviews.Author: Alvin B. Bernal
Reviews.Content: Remote deos not respond when buttons are pushed, TV slow to start. Do not buy this TV. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: Great television - until it breaks.
Reviews.Author: Gregg Yurchak
Reviews.Content: Should have listened to what people said about Vizio.  It's a matter of when, not if, it will break.  I now have the 'screen of death' (as I've learned it's called) less then 9 months after buying the TV.  Very disappointed.  After wading through so much online to see if I can fix it, I've now just come to the conclusion I'm better off never buying Vizio ever again.

Reviews.Title: What channel is it on?
Reviews.Author: speedo13
Reviews.Content: Have had this set almost five months and has worked smoothly most of the time.  Took a little more time than I expected to get it to connect to wireless, but few problems.  Picture is excellent, as is the sound.Only two (relatively) minor problems.  1) It takes FOREVER for the set to turn on, and changing channels isn't much faster.  This is more an irritant than a problem, but we Americans want what we want RIGHT NOW.  2) The numbers are TINY.  We have the set in the bedroom, watching it from the bed only 12 feet away, and it's almost impossible to read the channel on the display banner.  That normally wouldn't be such a problem, except that the number keys on the remote are so small (slivers, really, not buttons), it's a crapshoot as to which ones you actually hit, hence channel roulette.  The remote problem could be fixed with an aftermarket one, but then you lose the nice Netflix/Amazon Prime/VUDU dedicated keys.Overall, I'm not sad I bought this, but a little more attention to detail on the less important aspects would have been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: movie-like clarity
Reviews.Author: Jack Scheiner
Reviews.Content: perfect size for our bedroom and it is pleasant on the eyes. Color is so true that you can almost touch the facessound is great .  would not hesitate to purchase Vizio again we also have Vizio 56" tv .

Reviews.Title: Love my tv
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I've had my tv for about 6 months.  It's my first smart tv, and I love it.  It works well, there isn't any lag time connecting to Hulu, Netflix, etc.  The picture is great, and I haven't had any problems with it.  I am definitely not going back to a non-Smart tv.  I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: femizi
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for six months.its not bad at all.the YouTube app freezes after about 40 mins but I have gotten a way around it now so that does not bother me.the HD quality is great,but the remote is not QWERTY so its kind of a pain to use.I would generally recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great computer screen and tv
Reviews.Author: Michael Bodine
Reviews.Content: Product arrived quickly and is a great picture.  I streem tv on it in my office as well as use it as a computer screen.  Works great and set up quickly.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Jess Iqui
Reviews.Content: I've had this television for a of couple months now and I haven't had any problems. It was easy to connect to the internet and my cable provider. I haven't had any issues connecting to the internet through the wifi, but it could be because the television isn't particularly far from the wireless router and modem. It does lag about 10 to 15 seconds when it connects to Netflix, but it's not anything to get upset about. If you're experiencing any problems connecting it may be your internet connection that isn't very reliable or strong from where your television is located. Other than that, loving my new Smart TV.

Reviews.Title: excellent!
Reviews.Author: ramon felix
Reviews.Content: This is the second vizio tv i get from amazon, just because the excellent experience with the first one, NOTE: this tv says is 720, but not, is 1080p, the first is the same model but in 3D and this is a normal smart tv but i got a great image and sound with both of them. i recommend it.

Reviews.Title: LCD tv's just do not hold up like the old anologs
Reviews.Author: Croppled1
Reviews.Content: I have owned this tv since August 2012 . Backlight stopped working in March . Vizio wanted a credit card to warranty exchange and estimated about 10 days . I had just thrown the box away because they advertised in home repair for 32 and larger which was a big selling point for me as I am disabled and cant get out or package things easily  . I understand their side and why they are doing it this way . I was very sad as I gave up on a another product which I had a 3 year warranty on to buy this set because of three exchange failures during the warranty period . These new TV's just don't last like the old analog ones of which I can't remember but one repair for a lightening hit in all my 40 adult years .Bottom line if it would hurt you to have to buy a new tv every year based on my experience I would purchase the tv where you can get a affordable replacement warranty that pays shipping both ways and keep the box for the whole period .You cannot leave these in motorhomes or in a unheated room either like the old analongs . The tv is good itself and has a VGA input the newer ones do not . The speakers are not as good as Toshibas for instance . The remote is very nice but I prefer Bluetooth instead of having to point . Hope this provides some info others have not touched on .

Reviews.Title: only have had a week!

Reviews.Content: I love this tv i think it is amazing , if you plan on using netflix this is the TV for you . wish i could have afforded a bigger one ..But so far so good i have watched so many movies on this tv this week ..its amazing i will NEVER go back to a regular television...

Reviews.Title: Decent TV but very sluggish
